cluster_classes.class_description: Broad geographic units used to describe where phenomena, such as urban legends, spread or occur, including regions and continents.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: urban legends began to spread across regions and continents

members.entity_description: Geographical areas across which urban legends spread.
Large landmasses mentioned as destinations for spreading urban legends.

cluster_classes.class_description: Qualifiers that describe the global or large-scale spatial scope over which narratives or legends are disseminated.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: stories can be shared and disseminated at lightning speed, reaching a global audience ... around the world

members.entity_description: Global scope of dissemination of the Hook Man story.

args.new_description: Geographic units and spatial scope terms describing how widely narratives or legends are disseminated (e.g., regions, continents, worldwide).
args.justification: Both classes model where and how widely stories spread (regions, continents, around the world), so maintaining a separate qualifier vs. area class is an unnecessary distinction for this schema; a unified spatial reach class is more coherent.

args.new_class_group: Spatial Reach & Geography of Story Dissemination
args.justification: The merged class specifically captures the geographic and spatial reach of story dissemination, so a more precise Class_Group label clarifies its role while keeping it within the broader dissemination domain.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes model where and how widely stories spread (regions, continents, around the world), so maintaining a separate qualifier vs. area class is an unnecessary distinction for this schema; a unified spatial reach class is more coherent.

executed_decisions.new_class_group: Spatial Reach & Geography of Story Dissemination
executed_decisions.justification: The merged class specifically captures the geographic and spatial reach of story dissemination, so a more precise Class_Group label clarifies its role while keeping it within the broader dissemination domain.
